comment: This professor was awful. If you ask for clarification she will give vague feedback that isn't even on the topic I asked about. Instructions are never clear and are sometimes hidden in some file I would have never thought to find. The only way I found links to some of the assignments was because I emailed her. Absolute unorganized mess.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment:
This professor loves pointless trick questions and she loves to give contradictory advice. You have to  to do everything literally perfectly and some of her expectations aren't clarified until she takes points off for something she never mentioned.

Also the midterm takes so long that its a downright insult to anyone who has to work for a living.

If you want to get a well-paying job in GIS, take every class Dr. Ingram offers. Is there a lot of homework? Yes. Is she going to grade your work rather than give you a participation trophy? Yes. But we're not going to college for funsies- we're here to get skills we can trade for money in the job market. Dr. Ingram's classes teach you those skills

I've taken Ingram for a few GIS classes, and once you understand how she is as a professor you can get comfortable. She honestly wants you to succeed. I had an issue with a project and we emailed for a week and had meetings so she could help me figure out what was wrong. She really does care about her students and wants us to do well in the future.

I took this class online and at first it seems like a lot of work but in reality it was pretty simple. Every week theres a quiz based verbatim on the readings and then either a discussion or an assignment. No final. She tells you exactly what you need to do well on the assignements and sends reminders for when things are due. Easy A:)

I dropped her instantly. Shes way too intense of a grader from what i can tell and theres so many opportunities to lose points. You have to log in to her class minimum of 3 days a week, her syllabus makes it seems like she wants you to fail. You have to rename files you submit or you lose points. I got a feeling a C is the best grade possible

Professor Ingram is very precise, and expects the same from her students. If you put in the effort, you will get a good grade. She is very helpful if you need assistance in class, but first try to help yourself before reaching out.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took the 3315 class I hesitated on taking the professor at first, but turned out to be the best professor I can ask for at KSU! Gives a mix of standard and creative assignments. Responded to every minor question I had in a professional manner. Only wish there were video lecture for the class as extra learning material.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: No teaching in this class. Learn ArcGIS Pro before you take this class. She doesnt teach you how to do anything and then grades you on things you dont know how to do. Terrible teacher and not nice at all. Doesnt seem to care about the students or the program.

She won't tell you what you've done wrong on your maps, but will give you a zero if you don't correct it. This is not teaching. Also, when my dad was in the ICU dying at Emory, I had to send her proof so I wouldn't fail. She's mean spirited and doesn't answer questions politely.

Professor Ingram took the time to make sure you had the materials needed to learn the material in the course. I had very few questions in the course but when I did she was always able to explain in more detail and a way that made sense. I would highly recommend taking her course if your a GIS or Geography major!

I took this course online. We had several assignments, discussions, and quizzes. However, she only takes the highest half the assignments for a grade and all the discussions and quizzes minus the two lowest for a grade. Overall, that makes your grades really boost in her class. :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Taking Ingram online has been a big hassle. I went in to this thinking it would be a straightforward online class but not with Ingram. A lot of unnecessary work due weekly. She is super sassy if you email her a dumb question but still is helpful. Had to hold back questionable replies to not cause any problems. I wouldnt recommend her.
Took a couple of her classes on-line, great professor that will be available to help if you need it. She makes you work for your grade, but you learn the materiel, and she gives you extra credit

Being a Geography major this class was required and I felt that it had a reasonable workload while providing a solid introduction to GIS and Spatial Thinking (which is a necessity for anyone planning to pursue Geography/GIS). Overall this course was fun and easy (the discussions needing to be posted on different days was a bit annoying). (Easy A)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof. Ingram is great! Class was difficult sometimes but she made it as easy as she could. Instructions are very clear, and she grades rather leniently. Homework can bog you down; it's a very labor intensive class. Only complaint and it's kinda a big one: 4 hour long midterms and finals. Awful! There's no reason for it! But I'd still take again.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--Tests are tough

comment: Not good at all. Too much work for an online class. Tedious discussions must be posted on different days. Quizes, discussions and labs every week. 4 hour long midterm includes multiple choice, essay, identification, math, and a lab section. There is also a poster project and the final. I was deceived by her 4.3 rating, don't make the same mistake.

Excellent instructor - passionate & knowledgeable about the course material, and very dedicated to making sure everyone passes. She has 12 discussions and assignments throughout the semester - you technically only have to complete 6 of each if you do well as she drops the 6 lowest grades. She drops the 2 lowest quiz grades. She's a great choice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She passes everything off to grad student. Wants you to be a professional in ArcMap and Illustrator

Occasionally you have professors that make an easy subject unnecessarily difficult, obstruct graduation, waste your money. See Ulrike Ingram. Insists weekly discussions must be posted across 3 different days, as if reading maps/using GPS is complicated. Wants you to geocache(silly GPS game) but in TX my nearest cache was a 2.5 hour drive. I work.

If you do all the require assignments you can basically have the last two weeks of the semester off as she only grades 11 of 13 quizzes/discussions and 6 of 12 assignments. TAKE HER. Shes nice and helpful and this class will be an A if you do the work, otherwise you should drop out.

She is so straightforward with her course, if you do not get an A in her class it's because you are truly lazy. She is very helpful, always wants to help, and is a nice and fair professor. Like I said, she is so clear on everything. I finished this online class in two and a half months with an A because she is so straightforward.

The best online class ever. Surprisingly engaging and interesting even if you do not plan to continue. You will need the textbook for some of the assignments, but you might be able to get around it with careful planning. You can choose the assignments you want to do. If you need help, just ask! She will reply within the hour almost without fail.
Take her class! Professor Ingram is absolutely awesome. I hate geography but she made it fun and I learned a lot

Great professor. Had her for two other classes. She posts video tutorials to help students out with take-home assignments and she is always willing to help her students out! She is quick with replying to emails and posting grades.

Pleasantly surprised by the quality of this online course. Weekly quiz, discussion posts, readings, and assignment. This professor is very clear about her expectations and is always available if additional assistance is required. She seems very proactive. I would highly recommend!

Prof. Ingram is great.  She's very straight forward in her expectations.  There are weekly quizzes and labs most weeks.  Keep up with the assignments and you'll do pretty well.  The exams are pretty long, but a moderate amount of study and completing the labs and quizzes go along way.
Online Course- EASY & FUN A+!! Absolutely no exams...! Weekly quizzes and discussions, as well as four chosen assignments (also easy and fun!) Learned a lot and enjoyed every bit of it!

Took her online class and it was great. She's very organized and clear. Weekly discussion posts are interesting. A quiz each week over the area being discussed. No tests, but 4 papers and they were on fun stuff. Highly recommend her.

I took her online class. It was relatively easy. Three discussion posts and a quiz a week.  Four other assignments due at various times, you get to choose which assignments you like. She is very clear about what you need to do and when you need to it.  Everything is available on WebCt.  Great class overall.

I am in another one of her classes and I love this teacher.  She expects a lot from you, but she has taught me more than most other professors.  Expect to work hard, but learn a lot.  She is a fair grader and knows her stuff. Highly reccomended. Can't say enough about how great she is.

One of the best professors I have had at Kennesaw.  I took her in an online Geog class.  Class was very simple and easy.  Weekly quizzes, weekly discussions, and four additional assignments.  Drops 2 lowest grades.  Very quick to respond to emails.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!  Hope to take more of her Geog classes.
Very easy class. just do 4 essays, 12 weeks of 3 posts and 12 open book test and take as much as you want. got an A
I am in her online class, she is very good and expects your interaction and full commitment, but grades very fairly!
